clinical_study.brief_title: Lifestyle Intervention for Toddlers Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Lifestyle Intervention for Toddlers at Finnish Welfare Clinics

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute for Health and Welfare, Finland

clinical_study.source: National Institute for Health and Welfare, Finland

brief_summary.textblock: Study aims to pilot a family-centred tailored nutrition intervention at child welfare clinics, targeting the previously observed dietary defaults of Finnish children.

detailed_description.textblock: Eating habits can predict diet-related health problems and obesity. The defaults observed previously in the diet of Finnish children include low consumption of vegetables, fruits and vegetable oil-based fats, high consumption of sucrose, poor quality of drinks and low frequency of family meals. Child welfare clinic is the place to promote healthy lifestyles because most Finnish families visit there at regular intervals.

primary_outcome.measure: To promote child's and family's healthy diet
primary_outcome.description: Changes in family's dietary choices, knowledge and attitudes. Also changes in parent's motivation and self-efficiency to improve family's diet.

arm_group.description: The dietary intervention consists of tailored dietary counseling, information leaflets and self-evaluation cards given to the families.
Public health nurses continue their usual dietary counseling.

intervention.intervention_name: Intensified dietary counseling at child wellfare clinics.
intervention.description: The intervention is completed by public health nurses who receive updating education in nutrition. A special training in a family-centred lifestyle counseling method in implemented. The nutrition intervention consists of tailored dietary counseling, information leaflets and self-evaluation card given to the families in the intervention arm. In the control clinics, public health nurses continue their usual dietary counseling.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all families at their child's standard 6-month child welfare clinic visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- families with twins
- families who do not speak Finnish

overall_official.affiliation: Head of the Nutrition Unit, professor
